description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDING AND REDEVELOPMENT OF THE SITE FOR MIXED USES INVOLVING THE ERECTION OF A 5 STOREY BUILDING (PLUS BASEMENT AREA)  COMPRISING A RETAIL UNIT AND OFFICE ACCOMMODATION AT GROUND FLOOR LEVEL AND 4 FLOORS OF OFFICE ACCOMMODATION ABOVE, PLUS ASSOCIATED PLANT EQUIPMENT, PROVISION FOR 33 CAR PARKING SPACES (22 AT BASEMENT LEVEL)  AND ASSOCIATED LANDSCAPING.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Particulars and samples of the materials to be used on all external faces on the building, including fenestration, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works are commenced. Development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 3 - Details of those parts of the site not covered by buildings including any parking, service roads, sight lines, footpaths, hard and soft landscaping, surface treatment and boundary treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any development hereby permitted commences. These works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 4 - Details of the proposed slab levels of the building and existing site levels shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before work commences and the development shall be completed strictly in accordance with the approved levels and details.

Condition : 5 - The roof of the extension or flat roofed areas hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 6 - No demolition or construction work in pursuant of this permission shall be carried out on or before 08.00 hours or after 1800 hours on Mondays to Fridays inclusive, before 0800 hours or after 1300 hours on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Condition : 7 - The garages and/or car parking spaces (and/or disabled/cycle parking spaces) as shown on the approved drawing 8806/P/1G and 2K shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or buildings hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of a vehicle in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 8 - Details of cycle parking facilities (and disabled car parking bays) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and shall be installed prior to the occupation of buildings hereby approved and permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 9 - All plant and machinery shall be enclosed and soundproofed in accordance with a scheme previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any insulation, and such sound insulation shall be permanently maintained thereafter.

Condition : 10 - The tree planting/landscaping scheme, which should include full details of species, size of plants and spacing shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval and be implemented during the next planting season after the completion of the building operations on site, or within any such longer period as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The Council will require a maintenance period of 3 years during which dead, dying or defective trees, shrubs and ground cover must be replaced.

Condition : 11 - Before the building is first occupied, the means of access for disabled persons as indicated by drawing 8806/P/2K shall be installed to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.
Condition : 12 - No external lighting shall be installed without the prior written approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 13 - While the development hereby permitted is being carried out, suitable hardstanding shall be provided with wash down facilities for cleaning the wheels of vehicles and any additional accumulation of mud on the highway caused by such vehicles shall be removed without delay.

Condition : 14 - Before the retail use hereby permitted commences, a window display/shop front appropriate to the shopping area shall be provided to the front of the premises and shall be subsequently maintained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason for condition: To provide visual interest at the front of the premises and to avoid an undesirable visual break in the shopping frontage.

Condition : 15 - Two disabled car parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with condition No.7 before commencement of the use of the building hereby permitted and shall be used for purposes of providing disabled persons parking in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.

Reason for condition: To ensure suitable parking to the building for disabled persons.
